text: i woke up super excited about this. who is our team, and what are our next steps?
Charles and I just had a brief discussion about it. He’s gonna write up our thoughts and share!
there’s nothing that is making this look impossible at this point
YAYAYAYAYAYAYAYAY
^^ me being excited

SO! Here’s roughly how I see it:

- This engagement is focused on technical feasibility only. What can we do with existing data, what type of data works best, what additional information can we glean from said data.
- This engagement does not focus on the storytelling or integration pieces of system output. 
- The expectation would be to prove out the feasibility of this technology, create a system that can generate useful output, and guide the Innovation team towards 2017 data collection, with an eye towards a full system engagement for the 2018 marathon.

- Work would be broken into two phases, one for initial technology feasibility of image recognition, and another for working with that data to provide rich output relevant to the event and to be leveraged for storytelling (location, runner info, etc.)

- Phase One: Two weeks, by the end of which we should have an answer as to whether a system like this can work with existing social and official imagery. Technical resources only. 
- Phase Two: Commences after approval of Phase One output by adidas. Three weeks, the first two of which are focused on extending the output of phase one with rich metadata, with the last focused on advising adidas on 2017 marathon data collection methodology.  Creative staff joins for presentation guidance, but not for full product design or build out.

Cost: 
Phase 1: $33,200
Phase 2: $51,600 
Total cost: $84,800. 

<https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1Ofg0JMWGc1SPNIkzwu5RCtxSHHnq7-1XEAsfL7LmOLE/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U06DFL7BP|charlesv> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/charlesv/F48HT4U5U/adi_boston_budget|Adi Boston budget>
(phase 1 = collect) (phase 2 = concept)
why wouldn't we do design concepts for storytelling in phase 2?
not full - but something meaty?
and who are our proposed product partners
Really for my own internal budget sensitivity given adi voice conversations – I think it’s more relevant to a 2018 engagement, but could be useful for them upselling – happy to adjust and propose
it seemed on the table to me given our convo on friday, but curious if others felt differently

I do see it as more concepts to help them sell internally than actually designing a product at this stage though - there are enough integration and rights hurdles that would directly influence what we could build for ‘18
<@U0260V4K1> <@U026PHQ3J> thoughts?

I honestly don’t know this team (or the people they need to sell to) to know how much we’ll need to lead them to water on this. When I left, they all seemed pretty hyped on the tech-discovery so I could a see a world where we don’t need much by way of product concept. On the other hand, I don’t think we have a super compelling story yet (again, when I left the meeting) so if people are likely to poke at it, then I’d want to go in a little stronger
I’m not sure I’m adding anything helpful to this conversation
but there you go
also - I’d love to DD this one, even just the concept part of it. (in regard to James’s question about PP)
i think the weight of the tech part was biased by the personalities in the room. :slightly_smiling_face:
what are you implying
that we had a lot of talkative nerds! :slightly_smiling_face:

at any rate, I’m happy to go either way on this one. I think it makes a lot of sense to keep the scope narrow and tech focused. On the other hand, 2018 is a long way away, so it might make sense to deliver something that sticks in their heads
i want to leave them with a vision. even a high-level conceptual one.
their internal stakeholders are brand-driven
and if we DO get to build it in 2018 - we don't want to be stuck with the crappy idea that some internal designer built ad hoc to throw into their internal pitch deck
:wave: I’d like to be part of any broad concepting discussions
i realize i’m just a loud nerd
so i’d be ok sitting it out
Sounds good - i’ll add some time to bring in visual design at the end in addition to DD and work on presenting some concepts as part of final delivery
you are my favorite loud nerd <@U026PHQ3J> ! :slightly_smiling_face:
and thanks marbles!
Revised, costs are 35,200 / 59,600. Any other input before I send off a cleaned up note?
